intro: Crocodeilanthe bialata, commonly known as the Biala's tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its tall, unbranched trunk and large, frond-like leaves that can reach several meters in length. The plant has a unique reproductive system, producing both male and female spores on the same fronds. Its rhizome is thick and fibrous, providing structural support and aiding in nutrient absorption. Crocodeilanthe bialata plays an important ecological role in its habitat, contributing to forest biodiversity and soil stability.
